revised_title: Platelet Defects and Crystallographic Shear Planes in Non-Stoichiometric Rutiles
tldr: The authors studied platelet defects and crystallographic shear planes in non-stoichiometric rutiles using high-resolution electron microscopy. They found that these defects often occur in association with each other and explained their structure and precipitation mechanism using linear cation interstitial defect models. The cooling history plays a crucial role in determining the microstructures observed at room temperature in non-stoichiometric chemical systems.
